data.name: The Post’s response to Michael Kobold’s statement on Facebook

data.title: The Post’s response to Michael Kobold’s statement on Facebook
data.description: The Kathmandu Post would like to respond to Mr. Michael Kobold’s recent posts on Facebook and Instagram that call attention to the Post’s reporting and accuse its editors of being corrupt.
The Kathmandu Post would like to respond to Mr. Michael Kobold’s recent posts on Facebook and Instagram that call attention to the Post’s reporting and accuse its editors of being corrupt.

data.name: Watchmaker promising fire trucks for Nepal has a series of dodgy financial dealings—and a chequered past
data.message:
A year ago, when Grasruts was just starting out, we were contacted by Mr Kobold's assistant to start a crowdfunding campaign. This guy wanted to raise funds for his "Fire truck expedition". My whole team was so excited with their proposal.

As per our policy, we started doing some background research on Mr Kobold. Soon our excitement died after we found out that this guys was a con artist.

Grasruts being a small and powerless startup, we anonymously reported a fellow reporter with potential proofs of his past activities. Finally, the dodgy man is brought to light.

http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/ampnews/2018-12-20/watchmaker-promising-fire-trucks-for-nepal-has-a-series-of-dodgy-financial-dealingsand-a-chequered-past.html?__twitter_impression=true

data.title: Watchmaker promising fire trucks for Nepal has a series of dodgy financial dealings—and a chequered past
data.description: In January last year, the Nepal Tourism Board signed an agreement to grant $200,000 to the Soarway Institute for Development for its project, the ‘Nepal Firetruck Expedition,’ an initiative to bring second-hand fire trucks donated from the United States of America to Nepal.

data.name: Sroth Code Games

data.title: Crowdfunding? Crowdfunding in Nepal? Know More...
data.description:
What is crowd funding?

Crowdfunding is the practice of funding a project or venture by raising small amounts of money from a large number of people, typically via the Internet.

This modern crowdfunding model is generally based on three types of actors: the project initiator who proposes the idea or project to be funded, individuals or groups who support the idea, and a moderating organization (the "platform") that brings the parties together to launch the idea.

Crowdfunding in Nepal?

Crowdfunding is a new concept in Nepal which has been introduced by some company but not got any effective output through due do various reasons like not having a good marketing planning and campaigns, lack of market research and mechanisms to process in right order. Few social organization using foreign tool has been able to generate some amount of funding for the project which is basically for social work purposes. 

As startups are booming more in the Nepal, businesses where innovation and ideas are generating, crowdfunding would be one of the best method for entrepreneur to turn their ideas into reality. With proper guideline and right marketing tool, Nepal can also generate a good crowdfunding movement. Since Nepal market has a good taste of trying out new products as well as services, crowdfunding would also help Nepali people to generate new leads on this chain.

Here is the article of the company who has been legally organizing crowdfunding programs: They have listed a details report of their year status on their project:

https://medium.com/grasruts/a-year-of-crowdfunding-in-nepal-5f760acc584d

Crowdfunding for game?

Crowdfunding, where the players of the video games pay to back the development efforts of a game, has become a popular means of finding alternate investment routes. The crowdfunding mechanism for video games received significant attention in February 2012 due to the success of Double Fine Adventure (later renamed as Broken Age), a point-and-click adventure game which raised more than $3 million through the Kickstarter service, greatly exceeding the initial $400,000 request and becoming the highest funded project through Kickstarter at that time. A further boost to the model was seen in July 2012 when the Ouya, a low-cost video game console to be built on the open Android system and designed to take advantage of the mobile video game trend, surpassed $8 million in funding. By mid-2016, more than $186 million has been pledged to video game-related projects through Kickstarter alone.

The above survey suggest that, crowdfunding help in increasing manner for the game developers to help develop, market and publish game with good backups and future goals. It help a startup running a game development company and also to the indie game developer boost for better target and market.





Nepal as Market place

Nepal market is new for game development and gaming industry but good examples of the game such as “The classic Ludo” with 10 million downloads, “Haku Run” as a commercial game, with 50k+ downloads and a vast number of people playing popular games such as FIFA, Pro Evolution Soccer, Dota, PUBG, Clash of Clash of Clans suggest it about time the development ecosystem comes up with a game of local origin with local original contents. 

Nepali game development market is losing a lot in money to the international games and game publishers, out of which a market share can be redirected to Nepali games and developers to occupy the market gap as well as decrease foreign game in Nepali market and establish Nepali game in international market section.

We can see a market potential when kids goes to cybercafé to play games which has been trending since last 10 years and so just because of less accessible to gadgets and system. Right now approx. there are more than 100 gaming zone in valley itself. Personal PC and Gaming system and also increase a massive amount of gamer.

Why we are doing this?

This project is initiated to create and establish Nepali gaming and animation industry and to create our own identity and market share in global gaming market. To take an example, we can take inspiration from ideas such as Clash of Clans; we can see the gameplay they have created have used the mythical Viking figures and inspiration. Similarly we also can promote our culture, religion, natural heritages, and ethics with such gameplay which is really unique in the world. Millions of search hit on the terms “Everest, Sherpa, Himalayas etc” every month shows there is interest in the internet regarding these subjects. But the product regarding these topic is almost non existent. 

This would help to empower the youth in digital media as well create job opportunities in creative business while creating sound professionals in creative business such as games and animations.

Start a culture?

We are also hoping and working towards to make people come together and start positive initiations of backing ideas that create great products worthy of global market. Successful implementation of the crowdfunding idea can inspire people with idea to initiate and the consumer base will be directly responsible for the creation of various innovative ideas and products developed within the country.

Finally; addressing the lack of local and original content in Nepali market

Nepali gamers, audience and general people have been served a massive amount of creative contents such as games, animation, creatives etc. from international market and publishers. Even our big medias aren’t providing original and local content to our audiences. An indian franchise “Motu-Patlu” being played on Nepal Television is a prime example. We are working towards the goal of being able to produce our own contents for such media and creative entertainment verticals in our upcoming days.

However, the point important fact about crowdfunding campaigns still remains the people’s power to validate and help create products that can make impacts. We at ‘Sroth Code Games’ are also looking forward to the involvement of huge number of Nepali living in the country and abroad to help us create a product worthy of international gaming market.

NOTE: It seems, we’ll need 384 individuals involved in the survey so the data from survey is considered official. We recently crossed 200 people mark, still 184 to go. Fill up the form below to participate in the survey about Nepali Game Development industry. Get invited to play the demo when it goes live and stay updated during the whole journey.
Survey Form: https://goo.gl/forms/NUA5BvvJ5UfiqH2E2

It could not run all of its feature in our ec2 t2.nano instance and for obvious reason we had to disable its background processing....

data.description: Grasruts turned one today (Jun 19, 2018) and the whole team is thrilled to have completed a year of crowdfunding in Nepal. So much has happened in this one year.
